description.title: Custom Firmware, HALs, and Device Drivers for Embedded Autonomy
description.content:
We've also designed and developed firmware and low-level device drivers across diverse platforms including Linux, PX4, Ardupilot, ROS, and ChibiOS. The work involves integrating sensors, radios, and avionics into robust embedded systems powering drones, robots, and autonomous platforms.

Our team specializes in creating custom hardware abstraction layers (HALs), sensor interfaces, and communication stacks for mission-critical systems. We develop and optimize drivers for IMUs, GPS modules, ESCs, LiDARs, radars, telemetry units, and radio controllers.

For high-performance computing, NVIDIA Jetson and Xavier-based systems are utilized to bridge AI workloads with real-time control firmware. Integration with RTOS and middleware ensures deterministic response and seamless interoperability between subsystems.

From kernel-level Linux drivers to PX4 board ports and ROS hardware bridges, our firmware stack enables scalable, reliable operation across air, land, and marine robotic systems.

description.title: Engineering Adaptable Aerial Platforms
description.content:
The projects involved the design and development of a modular VTOL UAV platforms capable of operating in both fixed-wing and multirotor configurations. The system was engineered for autonomous long-endurance missions with vertical takeoff and landing capabilities.

The design integrates optimized aerodynamics, redundant propulsion, and real-time flight control using PX4 and ArduPilot frameworks. The airframe supports electric and hybrid propulsion, adaptable payload bays, and swappable wings for multi-mission flexibility.

Applications include defense reconnaissance, precision mapping, logistics delivery, and research missions — all supported by advanced onboard AI, GNSS-denied navigation, and secure telemetry systems.

description.title: Resilient Design for Challenging Terrains and Depths
description.content:
The projects focuses on the design and development of Unmanned Ground Vehicles (UGVs), Unmanned Underwater Vehicles (UUVs), and Remotely Operated Vehicles (ROVs) tailored for defense, industrial, and research applications. Each system is engineered for durability, autonomy, and adaptability in complex environments.

UGVs are built for all-terrain mobility and payload versatility, featuring drive-by-wire systems, obstacle detection, and autonomous navigation. UUVs and ROVs are optimized for subsea inspection, mapping, and intervention with watertight enclosures, thruster redundancy, and sensor fusion capabilities.

The platforms integrate ROS-based autonomy stacks, AI-assisted path planning, and real-time telemetry for remote supervision and mission control. Custom hardware and embedded firmware ensure seamless interoperability across surface, land, and underwater domains.

description.title: Automated Wagon Stability Analysis using Computer Vision
description.content:
The projects showcases an advanced AI-powered visual inspection system designed for detecting wagon disbalance in railway freight operations. Using thermal imaging and intelligent pattern recognition, the solution enables accurate load symmetry assessment even in complex industrial conditions.

The system delivers automated detection, visual overlays, and detailed analytical reporting — helping operators identify potential disbalance issues before they lead to mechanical strain or safety risks.

Developed for large-scale deployments, it supports batch image processing, automated data logging, and seamless integration with existing monitoring workflows. Its adaptive architecture ensures consistent performance across varied wagon types and environmental conditions.

Future versions aim to introduce real-time processing, multi-angle compatibility, and improved calibration models to enhance precision and operational flexibility across diverse railway inspection environments.

description.title:
Engineering Reliable Avionics
and Intelligent Power Systems
description.content:
Here we showcase our indigenous design and development capabilities in avionics and power electronics hardware for robotics and aerial platforms. Our team has engineered advanced control, communication, and power management systems purpose-built for drones, autonomous vehicles, and industrial applications.

Developed entirely in-house, the product range includes drone avionics, custom flight controllers, power distribution units, and embedded boards for AI edge computing such as NVIDIA Jetson carriers. These systems are optimized for performance, efficiency, and modular scalability.

We’ve also created hardware platforms for 3D printers, stepper driver standards, and precision motion controllers—bridging innovation between robotics, additive manufacturing, and aerospace systems.

Our focus remains on designing dependable, production-ready electronic systems that enable the next generation of intelligent, autonomous, and connected technologies.

description.title:
Coordinated Intelligence for
Autonomous Systems
description.content:
The projects focuses on the development of multi-agent autonomy frameworks and advanced swarming behaviors using the Robot Operating System (ROS) ecosystem. Our systems enable fleets of UAVs, UGVs, and UUVs to coordinate dynamically, adapt to changing missions, and operate in GPS-denied or contested environments.

We design and integrate distributed control algorithms, real-time communication layers, and cooperative decision-making logic, ensuring robust performance and scalability across air, ground, and underwater domains.

The architecture supports modular extensions for mission planning, vision-based coordination, and autonomous task assignment, allowing seamless integration into both simulation and real-world platforms.

Our swarming stack continues to evolve with advancements in AI, onboard perception, and mesh networking, powering the next generation of collaborative autonomous systems.
